The control described in the scenario is best described as a Detective control.

Detective controls are implemented to identify and detect potential issues or anomalies after they have occurred. In this case, conducting quarterly reviews where a different officer compares all the cleared checks against the ledger is a detective control. It aims to detect any potential fraud that may have occurred during the reconciliation process.

Although this control helps in detecting fraud, it does not prevent or deter it from happening. Preventive controls are implemented to stop issues before they occur, while deterrent controls are put in place to discourage individuals from engaging in fraudulent activities. Compensating controls are used to mitigate the risk when primary controls cannot be implemented. In this scenario, the focus is on detecting fraudulent activities, making it a detective control.
